steps.title: Chew up some crackers.
steps.content: Chew up some crackers. You can also break them up with your hands as well. [1] X Research source If you can't find any crackers, you can use biscuits or light-colored cookies (ie: vanilla wafers, sugar cookies, graham crackers, etc.). Don't use chocolate chip cookies or Oreos—those are way too dark!

steps.title: Spit the crackers into a plastic bag.
steps.content: Spit the crackers into a plastic bag. You can use a bowl, sink, plastic bag, or even a toilet. [2] X Research source If you want to make more vomit, chew up and spit out more crackers.

steps.title: Add some water, if needed.
steps.content: Add some water, if needed. If you spat the crackers into a toilet, you don't need anymore water. If you spat them into a bowl, bag, or sink, then add in a little water. This makes the vomit look more real. [3] X Research source You can also try some white vinegar, apple cider vinegar, apple juice , or even a little milk.

steps.title: Add something mushy and smelly.
steps.content: Add something mushy and smelly. Wet cat food or wet dog food work great for this. You can also use a little bit of canned tuna or baby food. It will help make the vomit look (and smell!) more real. [4] X Research source You could also chew up some cereal, spit it out, then mix it with vinegar.

steps.title: Leave the vomit for someone to find.
steps.content: Leave the vomit for someone to find. If you used the toilet, don't flush it! If you left it in a bowl or trash bag, you could take it to a parent, guardian, or teacher, and say that you threw up.

steps.title: Crush 10 crackers into bowl.
steps.content: Crush 10 crackers into bowl. Make sure that the bowl is safe to go into the microwave. If you can't find any crackers, some cookies or cereal would also work.

steps.title: Add ½ cup (40 grams) of dry oatmeal.
steps.content: Add ½ cup (40 grams) of dry oatmeal. The large, chunky flakes will look the best, but you can use the kind that are cut up too.

steps.title: Pour in 1 cup (240 milliliters) of water.
steps.content: Pour in 1 cup (240 milliliters) of water. Stir it with a spoon. Mash those cracker bits up so they get soggy.

steps.title: Microwave
steps.content: Microwave it for 30 seconds. This will be just enough to make the vomit a little chunky, but still watery. Use oven mitts or a pot holder to take the bowl out of the microwave.

steps.title: Toss in some corn or chopped up carrots.
steps.content: Toss in some corn or chopped up carrots. You could also chew up a mini carrot, then spit it back into the bowl. This will make the vomit look even more real.

steps.title: Add in a squirt of honey.
steps.content: Add in a squirt of honey. This will help give it some color and ickyness. If you don't have honey, you could try maple syrup, agave nectar, or pancake syrup.

steps.title: Stir it up with a spoon.
steps.content: Stir it up with a spoon. Make sure that you scrape the bottom and sides of the bowl.

steps.title: Let the vomit cool before you use it.
steps.content: Let the vomit cool before you use it. Pour it down the front of your shirt, or dump it into the toilet. Get some on the floor. You can also take some into your mouth, then lean over and spit it out. Make some puking sounds!

steps.title: Heat up ¼ cup (45 grams) of applesauce.
steps.content: Heat up ¼ cup (45 grams) of applesauce. Pour the applesauce into a small pan, and place it on the stove. Turn the heat up to low or medium. Wait for the applesauce to get hot enough to make steam. [6] X Research source Any type of applesauce will work. If you can't find any, try baby food.

steps.title: Stir in a packet of gelatin.
steps.content: Stir in a packet of gelatin. Don't use flavored gelatin, like Jello, or the vomit may change color. [7] X Research source If you only have Jello at home, try yellow or orange. It will give you a more natural color.

steps.title: Add in 1 to 2 pinches of cocoa powder.
steps.content: Add in 1 to 2 pinches of cocoa powder. Give the vomit another stir. Sprinkle it over the contents in the frying pan and stir. This will help give the vomit some color. [8] X Research source If you can't find any cocoa powder, you can use hot chocolate mix or even a pinch of dirt.

steps.title: Take the pan off the stove.
steps.content: Take the pan off the stove. Set it down onto a trivet or folded towel so that you don't ruin the counter.

steps.title: Add in some oatmeal and cereal for texture.
steps.content: Add in some oatmeal and cereal for texture. You will need a small handful of each. Give the vomit another stir to mix everything in. [9] X Research source If the cereal has large flakes, you can crumble them with your hands first. If you don't have Raisin Bran or Cornflakes, you can use another type of brownish, flaky cereal. Granola is a great one!

steps.title: Spread the fake vomit onto a plate.
steps.content: Spread the fake vomit onto a plate. Use a spatula to move the vomit from the pan to a plate. Spread it around into a vomit shape with a spoon. If you want to, you can add more oatmeal or crushed cereal on top. [10] X Research source Don't get too carried away!

steps.title: Let the vomit cool for a few hours.
steps.content: Let the vomit cool for a few hours. After that, you can take the vomit off the plate with a spatula and put it somewhere to gross someone out. [11] X Research source

steps.title: Squeeze out some glue into a mixing cup.
steps.content: Squeeze out some glue into a mixing cup. You can use a decoupage glue, like Mod Podge, or white school glue. Plan on squeezing out about 1/4 to 1/2 cup (60 to 120 milliliters). [12] X Research source Use a cup that you can throw away, like a paper one.

steps.title: Add a hint of brown.
steps.content: Add a hint of brown. You just need a tiny drop of brown food coloring, water color, or paint. The vomit will look light tan now, but it will get darker after it dries. [13] X Research source

steps.title: Stir it up until the color is even.
steps.content: Stir it up until the color is even. You can use just about anything to stir: a plastic spoon, a popsicle stick, a toothpick, etc. [14] X Research source

steps.title: Pour half of it out onto a sheet of parchment paper.
steps.content: Pour half of it out onto a sheet of parchment paper. Place the parchment paper onto a baking sheet first. Next, pour the glue onto the parchment paper into a vomit shape. Save the rest of the glue for later. [15] X Research source You can also use a sheet of wax paper or even plastic wrap.

steps.title: Add something chunky.
steps.content: Add something chunky. A handful of dry cat or dog food will look gross. If this is human vomit, you could try a handful of dry oatmeal or granola. Put most of the chunks in the middle of the glue puddle, and a few bits on the edges. [16] X Research source

steps.title: Cover the chunky bits with the rest of the glue.
steps.content: Cover the chunky bits with the rest of the glue. Simply pour the rest of your colored glue over the vomit puddle. Make sure that you cover all the chunky bits you added in. This will help seal them in. [17] X Research source

steps.title: Wait for the glue to dry.
steps.content: Wait for the glue to dry. The glue will turn clearish once it dries. This may take a few days. If you get impatient, let it dry for about 48 hours, then bake it for about 10 minutes in the oven at 275°F (135°C). [18] X Research source If you want to bake it, open up a window. It will stink! Don't put wax paper or plastic wrap into the oven. If you used those, you'll have to let it air dry.

steps.title: Peel the vomit off.
steps.content: Peel the vomit off. The glue will dry semi-flexible, but be careful not to bend it too much. Leave the vomit some place for your victim to find, like the floor or their pillow. Because this vomit is made from glue, it should last a very long time. [19] X Research source
